page.title: 10GLENLUCE WAYS
page.content: Here are some examples of {Local {Dialect}still commonly used. Throwing flat stones to bounce on water = skim or skiff. Gap in dyke = slap. Hairy Caterpillar = granny-moolie. Freezing = founert. Clot of wool or manure on animal = tartle or mackit. Smallest pig in litter = rig, runt or weaklin. This area celebrates many of the National Customs of the country. Children celebrate {Hallowe'en, {Guy Fawkes}and other special days eg. Thinking Day. The main day of the year is on the first Saturday in August. This is the annual{Sports Day. These sports have taken place for well over 100 years. They are open to professional athletes as well as locals.Other customs observed are {Burns Night}and a{midnight Christmas {Eve Service.
